usage_and_dosing.description: Neomycin is an oral aminoglycoside used as bowel preparation pre-operatively for resectional GI surgery and for treatment of hepatic encephalopathy. Systemic absorption can occur and lead to ototoxicity, neurotoxicity or nephrotoxicity (Black Box Warning). Low concentration in non-prescription topical creams and ointments. Active in vitro vs. staphylococci and most aerobic Gram-negative bacteria; resistant to streptococci and Gram-positive bacilli

adult_dose.dose: 1 gm at 1, 2 and 11 pm on day preceding surgery + Erythromycin 1 gm po at the same times + mechanical cleansing
500-2000 mg q6-8h for 5-6 days; seek safer alternative for longer use

pediatric_dose.dose: HE: 50-100 mg/kg/day (divided q6-8hr) x5-6 days. Seek safer alternative for longer use.

renal_adjustment.crcl_or_egfr: No dosage adjustment for renal impairment

comments: Avoid concomitant agents and factors that enhance oto-, neuro- or nephrotoxicity
For treatment of hepatic encephalopathy, considered an alternative agent; safer agents are available (Hepatology 60: 715, 2014).
